title: Boris Johnson's pal Jennifer Arcuri feels 'betrayed' that he hasn't called her
text:

Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s pal Jennifer Arcuri has told how she feels “betrayed” that he hasn’t called her since a storm blew up over their relationship.

The US businesswoman is at the centre of investigations into Johnson’s involvement in more than £100,000 worth of taxpayer-funded grants she received while he was London Mayor.

The police watchdog is also probing him over public grants totalling £11,500.

Ms Arcuri has been engulfed by claims of an affair with Johnson and her ex-boyfriend Joe Yukich said she had been left “pretty fragile” by the Boris storm.

He told the Sunday Mirror: “She was waiting to hear from him after the story broke, but she never did.

“It amazes me she was holding out hope that Boris would reach out and come to her aid. She’s extremely smart, but she’s naive like that. She’s feeling betrayed by the Boris camp now.”

Joe has spoken at length to 34-year-old Jennifer since her links to the PM emerged a fortnight ago.

(Image: Rowan Griffiths/Daily Mirror)

He added: “She was hoping Boris was going to be like a knight in shining armour and come to her rescue. It took her a while to understand politicians run to the hills when s*** hits the fan.”

Last month, it was revealed Ms Arcuri had received £126,000 of public money for her business ventures, some of which was paid while Mr Johnson, 55, was London Mayor.

It was also revealed he visited her London flat – which had a dancing pole – for “technology lessons”.

Ms Arcuri, who moved to California last year with her British partner Matthew Hickey and their daughter, is also alleged to have received preferential treatment when she went on three overseas trade missions led by Mr Johnson.

(Image: Rowan Griffiths)

(Image: Rowan Griffiths/Daily Mirror)

And there are now four inquiries into whether the PM broke rules by doing favours for Ms Arcuri. Mr Johnson has said there was no interest to declare.

Digital Minister Matt Warman has ordered a review into how a £100,000 grant was awarded in January to Hacker House, run by Ms Arcuri, and has frozen the unpaid £53,000 part of the grant.

Meanwhile, Joe, 60 – who claims Jennifer was also pals with the PM’s estranged wife Marina – said he has helped broker an interview with Good Morning Britain presenter Piers Morgan. The chat, set to be aired tomorrow, is likely to address a string of key questions

Joe has also contacted attorney Marty Singer, Hollywood’s go-to lawyer for reputation management advice.

(Image: PA)

And Jennifer’s long-time pal and lawyer Michael Walsh – also dealing with negotiations to sell her story – bizarrely claimed her exclusive interview will refer to “a pending dinner” with ex-US President Bill Clinton’s former mistress Monica Lewinsky.

Mr Johnson also faces claims he groped a female journalist 20 years ago, which he denies. But he refuses to say whether he and Ms Arcuri had a fling.

But in an exclusive interview with the Daily Mirror in Huntington Beach, LA, last week, she claimed the rumours were “complete b******t”.

She said: “This is not a Monica Lewinsky. The allegations are false and I am a legitimate businesswoman. He spoke at my event. He’s been after me forever.

"Men just trip over themselves in front of me. They fall in love with me in about 10 minutes.”

Later she told Bloomberg TV: “I will not be the person to bring Johnson down. He didn’t do me any favours. I was within my rights to go on those trade missions and apply for grants.

"My relationship with him is nobody’s business.”
description: EXCLUSIVE: The US businesswoman has been left 'pretty fragile' by the storm and her ex-boyfriend says she thought Boris would come to her aid
